derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin surdus 'deaf, mute'; as a mathematical term, translating Greek (Euclid) alogos 'irrational, speechless', apparently via Arabic jiḏr aṣamm, literally 'deaf root'. Sense 2 dates from the mid 18th cent

encyclopedia.content: surd，可译为不尽根数。如果a是一个有理数（rational numbers ），但不是某数的n次方，则a的n次方根称为surd of the nth order。 surd属于无理数（irrational numbers）。无理数包括两大类，algebraic numbers和transcendental numbers。前者是整系数方程的根，后者是其他无理数，如圆周率。surd是前者的一个子集。

means.word_mean: 1. a consonant produced without sound from the vocal cords
